meanings.definition: A person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
meanings.sent1: The new student was an enigma to the class, as no one knew anything about him.
meanings.sent2: Solving the mystery of the missing keys proved to be quite an enigma for the detective.
meanings.sent3: The enigma of the disappearing cookies in the office kitchen left everyone scratching their heads.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an enigma, hiding the pain she felt deep inside.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins held an enigma that archaeologists were eager to unravel.

meanings.definition: A riddle or puzzle, especially one that is enigmatic or perplexing.
meanings.sent1: The enigma presented by the Sphinx was said to be unsolvable by many.
meanings.sent2: The children spent hours trying to crack the enigma of the locked treasure chest.
meanings.sent3: The enigma of the missing sock in the laundry was finally solved—it was stuck to the inside of a shirt!
meanings.sent4: Life can be an enigma, with twists and turns that challenge our understanding.
meanings.sent5: The enigma of the jigsaw puzzle lay in the missing corner piece that no one could find.
